filmography.title: The Trouble with Harry
filmography.role_description: A young widow in a small Vermont town who is unbothered by the corpse of her husband found in the woods; MacLaine's film debut.
filmography.plot: The trouble with Harry is that he's dead, and everyone seems to have a different idea of what needs to be done with his body.

filmography.title: Artists and Models
filmography.role_description: A secretary and astrology enthusiast who becomes the love interest of Jerry Lewis in this colorful musical comedy.
filmography.plot: A struggling artist and his comic-book-obsessed roommate get mixed up with spies and beautiful women.

filmography.title: Around the World in 80 Days
filmography.role_description: An Indian princess rescued from a funeral pyre who accompanies Phileas Fogg on his global journey.
filmography.plot: A Victorian Englishman bets that with the new steamships and railways he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.

filmography.title: Some Came Running
filmography.role_description: A sweet, naive, and promiscuous factory worker who falls for a disillusioned writer and tragically sacrifices herself for him.
filmography.plot: A veteran returns home to the small town he left years before and finds himself torn between two women.

filmography.title: Ask Any Girl
filmography.role_description: A naive small-town girl who moves to New York City and tries to use scientific research to trap a husband.
filmography.plot: A young woman tries to find a husband in New York City by using modern business methods.

filmography.title: Can-Can
filmography.role_description: A Parisian nightclub owner in the 1890s who defies the law by presenting the scandalous Can-Can dance.
filmography.plot: A Parisian nightclub owner is sued for performing the Can-Can, but her lawyer has a trick up his sleeve.

filmography.title: The Apartment
filmography.role_description: An elevator operator trapped in a toxic affair with her boss, who finds solace with a lonely office worker.
filmography.plot: A man tries to rise in his company by letting its executives use his apartment for trysts, but complications and a romance of his own ensue.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress; Venice Film Festival: Win – Volpi Cup

filmography.title: The Children's Hour
filmography.role_description: A schoolteacher whose life is destroyed by a student's lie and who struggles with her repressed feelings for her colleague.
filmography.plot: A rebellious student at a girls' school accuses two teachers of having a lesbian affair.

filmography.title: Two for the Seesaw
filmography.role_description: A free-spirited, generous Bohemian dancer in New York who has a brief, intense affair with a straight-laced lawyer.
filmography.plot: A Nebraska lawyer flees his marriage to New York City, where he meets a dancer who helps him find himself.

filmography.title: Irma la Douce
filmography.role_description: A Parisian prostitute who falls in love with a former policeman who creates an alter ego to be her only client.
filmography.plot: A former policeman falls in love with a prostitute and tries to get her out of the business by paying for her time himself.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Comedy/Musical)

filmography.title: What a Way to Go!
filmography.role_description: A woman who only wants a simple life but is cursed to marry men who become incredibly wealthy and die, leaving her richer and unhappier.
filmography.plot: A four-time widow discusses her four marriages, in which all of her husbands became incredibly rich and died prematurely.

filmography.title: Gambit
filmography.role_description: A Eurasian dancer hired by a cat burglar to resemble a wealthy man's late wife to help steal a priceless statue.
filmography.plot: A cat burglar recruits a beautiful woman to help him rob a billionaire, but his perfect plan goes awry.

filmography.title: Woman Times Seven
filmography.role: Paulette / Maria Teresa / Linda / Edith / Eve / Marie / Jeanne
filmography.role_description: A tour-de-force performance playing seven different women in seven different episodes dealing with adultery and romance.
filmography.plot: Seven stories about adultery in Paris, all starring Shirley MacLaine.

filmography.title: Sweet Charity
filmography.role_description: An eternal optimist working as a taxi dancer in Times Square who continuously searches for love in the wrong places.
filmography.plot: A taxi dancer with a heart of gold but bad luck with men falls for a claustrophobic insurance actuary.

filmography.title: Two Mules for Sister Sara
filmography.role_description: A woman posing as a nun who enlists a mercenary (Clint Eastwood) to help her aid Mexican revolutionaries.
filmography.plot: A wandering cowboy rescues a nun from a gang of bandits, and they team up to help the Juarista rebels.

filmography.title: The Turning Point
filmography.role_description: A former ballerina who gave up her career for a family, now revisiting her past when her daughter joins a ballet company.
filmography.plot: When her daughter joins a ballet company, a former dancer is forced to confront her long-ago decision to give up the stage for a family.

filmography.title: Being There
filmography.role_description: The wife of a dying billionaire who mistakes a simple-minded gardener for a profound intellectual.
filmography.plot: A simple-minded gardener is mistaken for a insightful sage by a wealthy tycoon and the Washington D.C. political elite.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress (Comedy/Musical); BAFTA: Nomination – Best Actress

filmography.title: Terms of Endearment
filmography.role_description: An opinionated, difficult, but loving mother navigating her complex relationship with her daughter over 30 years.
filmography.plot: The relationship between a demanding mother and her daughter is followed over 30 years of marriage, affairs, and family tragedy.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: Madame Sousatzka
filmography.role_description: An eccentric and demanding Russian piano teacher living in London who mentors a gifted teenage prodigy.
filmography.plot: A Bengali piano prodigy is torn between his mother and his strict, eccentric teacher.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama); Venice Film Festival: Win – Volpi Cup

filmography.title: Steel Magnolias
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, cantankerous curmudgeon who hides her heart of gold behind a veneer of constant grumpiness.
filmography.plot: A young beautician arrives in a small Louisiana town and finds work at the local salon, where a small group of women share a close bond.

filmography.title: Postcards from the Edge
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant, alcoholic, former movie star mother whose relationship with her actress daughter is fraught with tension.
filmography.plot: An actress tries to get her life back on track after a drug overdose, forced to live with her overbearing mother.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress; BAFTA: Nomination – Best Actress

filmography.title: Used People
filmography.role_description: A recently widowed Jewish woman in 1969 Queens who is courted by an Italian man at her husband's funeral.
filmography.plot: At her husband's funeral, a Jewish woman is wooed by an Italian man who has loved her from afar for years.

filmography.title: Wrestling Ernest Hemingway
filmography.role_description: A lonely, somewhat bitter landlady who becomes the object of affection for a retired Irish seaman.
filmography.plot: Two retired men, an Irish seaman and a Cuban barber, form an unlikely friendship in Florida.

filmography.title: Guarding Tess
filmography.role_description: A demanding, widowed First Lady who torments the Secret Service agent assigned to protect her.
filmography.plot: A Secret Service agent is assigned to guard a former First Lady who treats him like a servant, until a kidnapping changes their relationship.

filmography.title: In Her Shoes
filmography.role_description: A grandmother living in a retirement community who helps her estranged granddaughters reconcile.
filmography.plot: Two sisters with nothing in common but their shoe size travel a bumpy road toward a true appreciation for one another, aided by their long-lost grandmother.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Bernie
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, detested widow in a small Texas town who befriends a beloved mortician, with fatal consequences.
filmography.plot: In small-town Texas, an affable mortician strikes up a friendship with a wealthy widow, but when he kills her, he goes to great lengths to create the illusion that she's still alive.
